page.syntax: Processed_HTML as C = *HTML_PROCESS(C html,C format[,C options[,C patterns]])

argument.name: format
argument.description: Character. Indicates which type of data to search for.

item.name: "K"
item.description: Kind of HTML tag (i.e. TABLE, INPUT, %A5)

item.name: "N"
item.description: Name (Type + Name or id)

item.name: "H"
item.description: Hierarchy (Parents + Type + Name or id)

item.name: "U"
item.description: Guaranteed Unique name (HIERARCHY + optional counter)

item.name: "T"
item.description: Contents of Tag (including <> characters).

item.name: "X"
item.description: Embedded Xbasic code (for a5w tags).

item.name: "E"
item.description: Trimmed Embedded Xbasic code (useful for expressions - which we don't want leading/trailing CR-LF's in)

item.name: "I"
item.description: inner HTML (inside a block tag)

item.name: "O"
item.description: Outer HTML (include outside tags of block, or just the tag itself if the tag is not a block)

argument.name: options
argument.description: Indicates how to process the data that is found.

item.name: "A"
item.description: process A5W tags only

item.name: "E"
item.description: process end tags as well as start tags

item.name: "M"
item.description: output merge - include all code not

item.name: "I"
item.description: make greps in search case insensitive

item.name: "T"
item.description: merge resumes after the current matching tag

item.name: "B"
item.description: merge resumes after the current tag block

argument.name: patterns
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of search options required to generate a match:

item.name: "<Format>=<value>"
item.description: Match an exact string.

item.name: "<Format>!=<value>"
item.description: Find strings that don't match.

item.name: "<Format>$<value>"
item.description: Find strings that match a regular expression.

item.name: "<Format>!$<value>"
item.description: Find strings that don't match a regular expression.

page.discussion: The *HTML_PROCESS() function returns information about a HTML file, such as: the contents of a tag the IDs of all the controls of a type an outline list of all HTML tags a named tag Xbasic code that matches a regular expression a version of the HTML without a tag a version of the HTML without a tag block a version of the HTML without Xbasic expressions that match a pattern its title, a list of input controls on the page.

item.name: K = INPUT
item.description: Process all html tags of type INPUT.

item.name: E = ?firstname
item.description: Process all html a5w tags where trimmed expression is ?firstname.

item.name: E$\?x_customer\.body.?
item.description: Process all html a5w tags that match the regular expression $\?x_customer\.body.?.

item.name: U=HTML|BODY|TABLE#1
item.description: Process object that matches unique name HTML|BODY|TABLE#1.

section.title: Retrieve the contents of a tag
section.description: Example 1 uses *html_process() to extract information from HTML. In the interactive window create an HTML string and extract the inner text of the title tag.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pages title</title><body></body></html>" ? *html_process(html, "I", "", "K=TITLE") = "The html pages title"

section.description: The result is the inner html ( Format: "I") of tags of type TITLE ( Search: "K = TITLE").

section.title: Retrieve the IDs of all the controls of a type
section.description: Example 2 retrieves the IDs or names of all the input controls on an html page.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id=\"firstname\"><input id=\"lastname\"></body></html>" ? *html_process(html, "N" + crlf() , "", "K=INPUT") = input:firstname input:lastname

section.title: Retrieve an outline list of all HTML tags
section.description: Example 3 generates an outline list of tags in the HTML text, which could be used to build a simple DOM browser.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id=\"firstname\"><input id=\"lastname\"></body></html>" ? *html_process(html,"U"+crlf() ) = html html|title html|body html|body|input:firstname html|body|input:lastname

section.description: This example visits all tags (except end tags) and a returns a hierarchical unique name for each.

section.title: Retrieve a named tag
section.description: Example 4, given a unique name, example 4 extracts a tag.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id=\"firstname\"><input id=\"lastname\"></body></html>" ? *html_process(html, "T", "", "U=html|body|input:firstname") = <input id="firstname">

section.description: Combined with example 3, this example could be used to browse tags.

section.title: Retrieve Xbasic code that matches a regular expression
section.description: Example 5 extracts embedded Xbasic that matches a regular expression.
section.example: html= "<html><body><%a5 ? x_customer.body.title %><%a5 ? x_customer.body.detail %><%a5 ? x_product.body.title %><%a5 ? x_product.body.detail %></body></html>" ? *html_process(html,"E"+crlf() ,"A","E$.+customer.+") = ? x_customer.body.title ? x_customer.body.detail

section.description: The "A" option indicates that only embedded Xbasic tags should be processed. The "E$" search denotes a regular expression to match against expressions. This makes use of the regular expression merge functionality.

section.title: Remove a tag
section.description: Example 6 removes a tag from HTML.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id=\"firstname\"><input id=\"lastname\"></body></html>" ? *html_process(html,"","M","U=html|body|input:firstname") = <html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id="lastname"></body></html>

section.description: When the merge flag is used ( Option: "M") and the format is NULL, *html_process() deletes the tag.

section.title: Remove a tag block
section.description: Example 7 removes a tag block from HTML.
section.example: html = "<html><title>The html pagestitle</title><body><input id=\"firstname\"><input id=\"lastname\"></body></html>" ? *html_process(html,"","MB","U=html|title") = <html><body><input id="firstname"><input id="lastname"></body></html>

section.description: When the merge and block flags are used ( Option: "MB") and the format is NULL, *html_process() deletes the block.

section.title: Remove Xbasic expressions that match a pattern
section.description: Example 8 removes expressions that match a pattern.
section.example: html = "<html><body><%a5 ? x_customer.body.title %><%a5 ? x_customer.body.detail %><%a5 ? x_product.body.title %><%a5 ? x_product.body.detail %></body></html>" ? *html_process(html, "", "AM", "E$.+customer.+") = "<html><body><%a5 ? x_product.body.title %><%a5 ? x_product.body.detail %></body></html>"

section.description: Since the format is empty, all matching expression tags get eliminated from the html.
